name: query InfluxDB for Event+dir median DetectedObjectVelocity
create Frigate /api/subLabel request to event for speed
init: switch to JSON, MPH, no factions
info:
"ON" & "OJ" & "F0" & "US" & "S2" & "K+" & "A!"

**ON** Detected Object Write
Sensor determines if an object is present by
looking for 2 consecutive speed reports. If
met, the max speed detected is reported. If a
faster speed is detected, additional speeds are
reported. This lowers the number of speed
reports for a given detected object. Use On to
turn the mode off.

**OJ** JSON Mode Write
Turns on output to format data in JSON
format. An example would output:
{"speed":"0.06"}. Use Oj to turn off JSON
mode.

**Fn** Decimal Places Write
Set n to the number of decimal places to be
reported. For example, setting to F2 will
report 2 decimal places (ex. 10.35). F0 will
provide the integer value only. Valid values of
n are 0-5.

**US** Miles per hour Write {"Units":"mph"} Calculations are based on the
international mile (1,609.344 m per mile).

**S2** 20K samples/second Write

**K+** Peak Speed Average Enable Write Enables speed averaging of peak detected
values across the nearest two speeds
detected. (-A, -C)

**A!** Save Configuration Write Saves current configuration settings in flash
memory. Upon power loss or recycling power,
the saved configurations will be used as the
default.

name: init: change range to not report
if payload has key TimedSpeedCounts & count > 0
info:
TimedSpeedCounts default to 1-minute intervals
- `count` represents number of objects at any speed
- `average` represents the mean speed (average of units for all counts)
- `units` represents the `average` units
- `direction` indicates inbound/outbound relative to radar, will have both each interval

name: get human readable timestamp, after 4 secs
query Output settings, after 0.1 secs
info:
**O?/o?** Output Settings Write
Output current output settings for speed and
range. Use O? for speed settings and o? for
range settings.

name: format data for influxdb TimedSpeedCounts measurement
variables to pass
info:
Via Docker Environment 
- `device_ip` of Pi (for influxDB server)
- `location` string (for influxDB `location` tag)
- `radar_camera` name of camera (for attaching speeds to events) - needs to match Frigate config

name: format data for influxdb DetectedObjectVelocity measurement
if payload has key speed
info:
TimedSpeedCounts default to 1-minute intervals
- `count` represents number of objects at any speed
- `average` represents the mean speed (average of units for all counts)
- `units` represents the `average` units
- `direction` indicates inbound/outbound relative to radar, will have both each interval

name: format data for influxdb speed, magnitude measurement, inbound
format data for influxdb speed, magnitude measurement, outbound
after label is car or bike
calculate direction, add topic `event_end_car_bike`
create influxdb query based on msg, +/- 2 sec all directions, return median
join Event+Radar
